a.h1: Ada-Borup School District Committed to Excellence

div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

div.p: The Ada-Borup Booster Club would like to offer each of our senior class students one free yard sign to celebrate our students. Additional signs can be purchased for $12 per...
Hello parents- school nurse Tracy here just reaching out to all the parents and guardians who are going through this pandemic “alone together.” There are so many factors...
Governor Walz announced this morning closures of all schools to students in Minnesota beginning Wednesday, March 18 through Friday March 27. Ada-Borup Schools WILL be...

p.a: Event: Last Day of Cougar Pack

div.p: Families who are in the medial or health care field or are considered emergency staff and are in need of childcare services during the school closure, please see the attached document. This will be going home with students and is on the school website. https://5il.co/drz0

The Ada-Borup Prom will be postponed from May 2nd to May 16th. We will continue to follow the District Calendar, so no school on April 10th or 13th. Graduation is still set for May 23rd. These are subject to change per State Mandate.

Because of this Covid-19 issue, manufacturers and suppliers have had their schedules and supply chains turned on their head. One such manufacturer is Dean Foods, our milk supplier. Due to staffing issues caused by "social distancing", Dean Foods is only able to produce chocolate 1% and white 1%. As a result, students may not be able to choose the flavor they want, but they WILL have milk.

Ada-Borup School District Updates:
You can view the Ada-Borup Distance Learning Plan at https://go.aws/3dyae5M
If you would like to continue/or be added on the Ada-Borup Student Meal Program, please contact the High School or Elementary Office 218-784-5300/218-784-5303
If your child is enrolled in the Emergency Workers Child Care Program, please contact the Elementary Office to schedule for next week 218-784-5303.
Take care!

The Ada-Borup School District distance learning plan is available here - https://5il.co/e6i9 It can also be viewed on the school website. Just a reminder that distance learning will go into effect starting Monday, March 30.
